numberValidator.message: The document root element must be a catalog, a provider or a course

furtherInformation.div:
The document root element must be a <catalog>, a <provider> or a <course> element within the http://xcri.org/profiles/1.2/catalog namespace.
XCRI Documents element within the XCRI-CAP 1.2 wiki specification
Ensure that the document root element is one of the expected XCRI-CAP 1.2 elements and that the document namespace is correct.

urlValidator.message: All url elements must contain valid URLs

furtherInformation.div:
All url elements are expected to contain valid URLs to indicate a place on the provider's website where further information can be obtained.
<url> element within the XCRI-CAP wiki specification
Ensure that the URL value is fully-qualified valid and publically accessible. Typically the URL should start with "http://".

furtherInformation.div:
Date elements should not be used but, instead, use the start element and the temporal elements defined within the Wiki e.g. end, applyFrom and applyUntil.
The Common elements within the wiki
Replace the date element with another of the temporal elements.

manualValidator.message: The contributor element should not be used for general contact information and should only be used when other refinements (e.g. presenter or lecturer) are not available.

furtherInformation.div:
The contributor element should not be used for general contact information.
The contributor element within the wiki
If other elements are suitable, they should be used in preference.

urlValidator.message: Producers should use URLs for identifiers

furtherInformation.div:
Any identifier element with no type refinement must be a uniform resource identifier conforming to the URL scheme specified by IETF RFC 3986.
The identifier element on the wiki
IETF RFC 3986

Ensure that any identifier elements without types refinements (xsi:type attributes) are Uniform Resource Identifiers. If the identifier uses a specific encoding scheme (e.g. a UK Provider Reference Number) then ensure that it has an associated xsi:type attribute.

manualValidator.message: Producers should use URLs for identifiers that also resolve to human-readable content.

furtherInformation.div:
Producers SHOULD use URLs for identifiers that also resolve to human-readable content.
The identifier element on the wiki
Ensure that any identifier elements without types refinements (xsi:type attributes) are Uniform Resource Identifiers and that these URIs resolve to human-readable content.

manualValidator.message: In the qualification element, producers should use the title element for the name of the qualification - preferably as given by its Awarding Body.

furtherInformation.div:
In the qualification element, Producers SHOULD use title for the name of the qualification, preferably as given by its Awarding Body.
The title element on the wiki
Ensure that any title element within a qualification element contains the name of the qualification, preferably as given by its Awarding Body.

manualValidator.message: Each subject element must contain one (and only one) keyword, phrase or classification.

furtherInformation.div:
Each subject element must contain one (and only one) keyword, phrase or classification. Producers should use xml:lang and xsi:type attributes, where appropriate, to provide alternative language versions and encoding schemes respectively.
The subject element on the wiki
Ensure that each subject element contains one (and only one) keyword, phrase or classification.

Subject elements cannot be empty.
The subject element on the wiki
If the subject element is not used, remove it.

stringLengthValidator.message: Producers must not create an abstract that exceeds 140 characters

furtherInformation.div:
The abstract element cannot contain more than 140 characters.
The abstract element on the wiki
Shorten or truncate the text within the abstract element.

regularExpressionValidator.message: Each email node should contain an email address

furtherInformation.div:
Each email node should contain an email address conforming to the "addr-spec" production in RFC2822.
RFC8922
Ensure that the email node contains an email address.

regularExpressionValidator.message: Telephone numbers should be formatted as they would be dialed from the UK

furtherInformation.div:
Each phone and fax element should contain a telephone number as it would be dialed from the UK. The National Format Layout is cited as a recommended format.
National Format Layout
Ensure that each phone and fax element contain a telephone number in the National Format Layout format.

regularExpressionValidator.message: A postcode, if provided, should conform to the UK postal code format

furtherInformation.div: Each postcode element should contain the full UK postcode of the respective provider's main site or venue of a presentation.
Ensure that the postcode contains a full valid UK postcode.

emptyElementValidator.message: If a provider uses a duration element, it cannot be empty.

furtherInformation.div:
A duration element must contain textual content.
The duration element on the wiki
Ensure that the duration element contains textual content or drop it from the XML document.

ageValidator.message: The value of the age element must be formatted in one of the four formats enumerated on the wiki.

furtherInformation.div:
The age element must be one of "age", "not known", "x-y, or "x+" (where x and y must be non-negative integers). Additionally, if of the format "x-y", the value of x cannot be greater than the value of y.
The age element on the wiki
Ensure that the age element is one of the four formats enumerated on the wiki.

regularExpressionValidator.message: Any explicit language set must be one of the 2-character ISO 639-1 character codes.

furtherInformation.div:
Any XML "language" attributes (xml:lang) must contain a valid language according to the 2-character ISO 639 codes.
A full list of the ISO 639-1 character codes, as documented by the American Library of Congress.
Ensure that the xml:lang tag contains a valid 2-character code.

stringLengthValidator.message: Description elements with a href attribute must not contain content.

furtherInformation.div: Description elements that have a href attribute must not contain any content; the content is expected to be obtained from the URI in the href attribute.
Decide whether the description element should contain content or link through to an external resource.

stringLengthValidator.message: Description elements without a href attribute must contain content.

furtherInformation.div: Description elements that have a href attribute must not contain any content; the content is expected to be obtained from the URI in the href attribute.
Decide whether the description element should contain content or link through to an external resource.
